content.p: Which of the following macromolecules are used for the following functions?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Lipids can be used for energy only after the simple carbohydrates have been used.
Incorrect. After the carbohydrates have been used other macromolecules can be broken down for energy.
Incorrect. Proteins can be broken down for energy as a last resort.
Correct. All of these molecules are used in the production of energy.
Correct. Simple carbohydrates such as glucose and fructose can be used as quick energy because they are broken down quickly into ATP through cellular respiration.
Incorrect. Proteins can be broken down for energy as a last resort.
Incorrect. Lipids can be used for energy only after the simple carbohydrates have been used.
Incorrect. All of these macromolecules can be used for energy but carbohydrates are the source for quick energy.
Incorrect. Carbohydrates such as starch and glycogen can store energy but lipids store it more efficiently.
Incorrect. Proteins can be broken down for energy as a last resort but have many functions other than storing energy.
Correct. Lipids can be used for energy and can store the most energy in their many hydrogen bonds.
Incorrect. All of these macromolecules can be used for energy but lipids are the macromolecules that store energy.

body.p: Can be converted for energy as a last resort:

response.feedback: Incorrect. Simple sugars are regularly used as energy.
Correct. Proteins can be converted for energy as a last resort.
Incorrect. Fats are regularly used as long term energy sources.
Incorrect. Although all of these can be converted for energy, onely one is a last resort energy source.

body.p: Needed for the absorption of certain vitamins:

response.feedback: Incorrect. Carbohydrates are polar molecules and are not able to solubilize the hydrophobic vitamins. Lipids and fats have surfactant properties so they can.

Incorrect. Some proteins are needed for the transport of vitamins and other hydrophobic materials. However, in the digestive system it is primarily the lipids that solubilize the hydrophobic vitamins.
Correct. Lipids are needed for the absorption of certain vitamins.
Incorrect. Only a molecule with a significant hydrophobic part can solubilize similar (hydrophobic) vitamins.
Partially correct. Carbohydrates are used to make cell walls in plants and parts of extracellular matrix in animals, but it they are not the only macromolecules used to make celluar structures.
Partially correct. Structure is one of the main functions of proteins. The cytoskeleton consists of different proteins, but they are not the only macromolecules used to make celluar structures.
Partially correct. Lipids are structural for plasma membranes, but it they are not the only macromolecules used to make celluar structures.
Correct. All these molecules are used to make cellular structures.
